messages.subject: Re: Sugar, was eczema OT
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/25/2003 12:19:25 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Exactly!  And he eats a lot of other things too, not JUST sugary treats. But, in fact, I ve
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/25/2003 12:19:25 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> So, I can't say what I mean...
>
> I assumed the poster meant sweets when she wrote sugar, so I said sugar.
> But Sandra is right, no one would eat *just* sugar all day. (Not even
> Julian!<g>)
>
> What about sweets? If a kid is eating cake and cookies he's getting
> sugar but he's also getting flour and oil, which are in bread and other
> foods, and unless you're vegan, milk and/or eggs which are considered by
> some to be food products in their own right. Maybe they're getting
> peanut butter or oatmeal, too.
>
>

Exactly! And he eats a lot of other things too, not JUST sugary treats. But,
in fact, I've never seen him sit and eat sugar. Honey. Maple syrup. But
refined sugar, no. And in restaurants with it sitting there, he mostly wants to
play table football with the packets.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
